subskills.DESCRIPTION: Identify basic materials (wood, plastic, metal, paper) that could be used to build simple structures
Compare two simple solutions to the same problem and explain which works better
Draw a sequence of 2-3 steps showing how to build something simple
Sort objects by their physical properties (size, shape, weight) for use in design
Communicate design ideas to classmates using simple words and gestures
Follow a 2-step pictorial instruction to build a simple structure
Identify when a design isn't working and suggest one way to fix it
Match tools to their basic functions in building (hammer for nails, scissors for cutting)
Demonstrate safe handling of basic classroom tools and materials
Record observations about a design using pictures and simple words
Identify a simple problem in the classroom that needs a solution
Build a simple structure that can hold a small object off the ground
